3.2. Styling the Page¶

  1. Till now we have seen a very basic code to print simple plain text on the webpage.
  2. But it dosent look appealing on the part of user who would be viewing our website.
  3. We need to format the page by changing its look and feel.
  4. Let us start.

3.2.1. Style attribute¶

  1. To change the style of an HTML element, we use the style attribute, which has the following syntax.

style="property:value"

3.2.2. Headings¶

  1. In HTML, there are 6 heading tags, which change the size of the text, to make it look like a heading.
  2. Different headings have different size format, as shown below.

<html>
<head>
<title> Second Example </title>
</head>

<body>
<!--H1 is the biggest and H6 is the smallest -->
        <h1> Heading 1 <h1>
        <h2> Heading 2 <h2>
        <h3> Heading 3 <h3>
        <h4> Heading 4 <h4>
        <h5> Heading 5 <h5>
        <h6> Heading 6 <h6>

<footer>
        <p>&copy www.Crestrou.com</p>
</footer>

</body>
</html>

  1. So we can change the the size of our first example by using <h1> tag and see the result.

3.2.3. Alignment of Text¶

  1. To change the alignment text, we use text-align property, which specifies the horizontal alignment of text.

text-align: left|right|center|justify|initial|inherit

<!DOCTYPE html>

<html>
<head>
<title> Fourth Example </title>
</head>

<body>
<!--Add the text-align:center property for each line -->
        <h1 style=text-align:center>Hello World</h1>
        <h1 style=text-align:center>How</h1>
        <h1 style=text-align:center>Are</h1>
        <h1 style=text-align:center>You</h1>

<footer>
        <p>&copy www.Crestrou.com</p>
</footer>
</body>
</html>
  1. Example Link example04
  1. Here we have specified seperately for each line. In case of repetitive work, this will not be efficient.
  2. Let us look at a more smarter way to work on this.

3.2.4. <p> Tag¶

  1. <p> tag marks a paragraph.
  2. Browser automatically adds some space (margin) before and after <p> element.
  3. The margin can be modified with CSS(with margin property).
  4. Below is the example to see the difference.

<!DOCTYPE html>

<html>
<head>
<title>Example For Styling </title>
<style>
        h1 {
                text-align:center;
        }
</style>
</head>

<!--Add the background color as cyan -->
<body style="background-color:cyan">
        <h1>Hello World</h1>

        <!-- To change the text color to blue -->
        <h1 style="color:blue">How</h1>
        <h1 style="font-family:Della Respira;">Are</h1>
        <h1>You</h1>

        <!-- Example for <p> tag -->
        This line1 is without `p` tag.<br>
        This line2 is without `p` tag.
        <hr>
        <p> This line1 is within <b>p</b> the tag.</p> <br> 
        <p>This is also within the tag.</p>

        <!-- different looks for hr -->
        <hr style=width:560px;height:30px;color:red;background-color:red>
        <hr size="30">
<footer>
        <p>&copy www.Crestrou.com</p>
</footer>
</body>
</html>
  1. Example Link example06

3.2.5. <br> Tag¶

  1. In the above example we saw a tag <br>. It is the line break tag, used to split a single line into two.

3.2.6. <hr> Tag¶

  1. The <hr> tag is the Horizontal Rule tag.
  2. It is used to insert a horizontal line in the page.
  3. A simple horizontal rule is inserted using <hr> tag as shown in above example.
  4. We have formatted the HR by using different attributes
  5. width : to change the width of hr across the page.
  6. height : to change the thickness of the line. Use px as unit.
  7. size : this also is used to change the thickness of the lines. No unit required.
  8. color : to give the border color.
  9. background-color : to change the fill of the hr is size is more.

3.2.7. See the Color Palette in the file ColorPalette.png¶

3.2.8. Body Background¶

  1. The background-color property defines the background color of the page as shown in above example.

3.2.9. Text Color¶

  1. The color property defines the text-color of the element. In this example we have changed the color of How to blue.

3.2.10. Font¶

  1. We can change the font of the text by using the font-family attribute.
  2. The syntax

style="font-family:Verdana"

It is shown in above example.
